IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROMOTE AND ENHANCE THE CREATION, PERFORMANCE, AND APPRECIATION OF THE ARTS IN THE MINNESOTA COUNTIES OF BENTON, SHERBURNE, STEARNS AND WRIGHT BY PROVIDING GRANTS AND SERVICES TO ARTS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, CITIES, SCHOOLS AND INDIVIDUALS. THESE GRANTS AND SERVICES SUPPORT ARTS, ARTS ACCESS, ARTS EDUCATION AND CULTURAL ARTS.
IRS990.Desc: GRANTS IN SUPPORT OF NONPROFIT ARTS ORGANIZATIONS, ARTS PROGRAMMING IN REGIONAL SCHOOLS, INDIVIDUAL ARTIST AWARDS AND TRAININGS, YOUTH SCHOLARSHIPS TO CONTINUE THEIR ARTS EDUCATIONS, PUBLIC ART GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS AND CITIES

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT GRANTS FOR NONPROFIT ARTS ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUAL ARTIST AWARDS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD ON ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, WHICH ADDRESSES THE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER TAX BENEFITS CLAIMED OR EXPECTED TO BE CLAIMED ON A TAX RETURN SHOULD BE RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. UNDER THIS GUIDANCE, THE ORGANIZATION MAY RECOGNIZE THE TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. THE TAX BENEFITS RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FROM SUCH A POSITION ARE MEASURED BASED ON THE LARGEST BENEFIT THAT HAS A GREATER THAN 50% LIKELIHOOD OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THE GUIDANCE ON ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES ALSO ADDRESSES DE-RECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES ON INCOME TAXES, AND ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE TAX POSITIONS FOR THE ORGANIZATION AND CONCLUDED THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS GUIDANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO INDICATE ACCEPTANCE AND REMAIN ELIGIBLE FOR A CMAB GRANT, THE GRANT RECIPIENTS AUTHORIZING OFFICIAL MUST SIGN AND RETURN A CONTRACT THAT OUTLINES THE GRANTEE EXPECTATIONS. THE GRANT RECIPIENT WILL BE HELD LEGALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT AND THE PROPER MANAGEMENT OF GRANT FUNDS WITHIN TWELVE MONTHS OF AWARD NOTIFICATION. ANY SIGNIFICANT REVISIONS TO THE PROJECT MUST BE REQUESTED AND APPROVED BY THE CMAB IN ADVANCE AND IN WRITING. THE GRANT RECIPIENT MUST MAINTAIN RECORDS FOR THREE YEARS BEYOND THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT DOCUMENTING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. AN ACCURATE FINAL REPORT INDICATING THE ACTUAL REVENUE AND EXPENSES MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE CMAB, USING THE ONLINE FORM, NO LATER THAN 60 DAYS FROM THE PROPOSAL END DATE. CMAB STAFF, BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND/OR INTERN MAY ATTEND ONE OR ALL ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY THE CMAB GRANT. THE CMAB MAY TERMINATE A GRANT CONTRACT AT ANY TIME UPON THE FAILURE OF THE GRANT RECIPIENT TO COMPLY WITH ONE OR MORE OF THE CONDITIONS OF THEIR CONTRACT. THE CMAB RESERVES THE RIGHT TO AUDIT THE FINANCIAL RECORDS OF PROJECTS THAT RECEIVE GRANT FUNDS. GRANT RECIPIENTS MAY BE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A CERTIFIED AUDIT REPORT OF THE ORGANIZATION OR OF THIS SPECIFIC PROJECT FUNDED BY THE CMAB.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD IS GIVEN A COPY OF THE 990 DURING AN OPEN MEETING TO REVIEW AND COMMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DECLARE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST DURING GRANT REVIEWS AND ANY VOTES ON EXPENDITURES. IF A CONFLICT IS IDENTIFIED THE MEMBER LEAVES THE BOARD ROOM DURING THE DECISION AND VOTE. THEIR ABSTENTION IS NOTED IN THE MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PERFORMS AN ANNUAL REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. SALARY IS DETERMINED USING COMPARABLES AND FEEDBACK FROM PEERS THROUGH A SURVEY MONKEY THAT THE BOARD USES TO DETERMINE ANY INCREASES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE INSERTED IN THE BIENNIAL PLAN THAT IS SUBMITTED EVERY OTHER YEAR TO THE STATE OF MINNESOTA. IT IS ALSO PRESENTED TO THE PUBLIC DURING A PUBLIC HEARING SCHEDULED IN THE REGION. DOCUMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE.
